data.title: Best Burger Ever!
data.text: If you are looking for the best burger in the world, look no further... come on down to Grill'em All in Alhambra, CA and order the Dee Snider burger! It has peanut butter, jelly, bacon and siracha... sounds gross, I know, but when all of those flavors mix they create a magical goodness that will make your taste buds happy! Joshua provided excellent customer service! This place is a real treat! Stop on by and see for yourself!

data.title: Oh wow, tasty!
data.text: Nothing bad to say about this place! Good service, awesome burgers and fries, goooood metal music. I am in love! Maybe the best burgers I've had so far..

data.title: This place always hits the spot...
data.text:
Absolutely freaking amazing!!!! I visit this place at least 4 times a month and it never gets old. They offer a "Burg of the month" so always check that out.
Mondays they have the totally amazing Molly Hatchet... 

Everyone should try this. And they offer veggie friendly burgs, too.

data.title: SO GOOD!
data.text:
We have eaten here a few times and came for dinner while in LA for our honeymoon, as usual they did NOT disappoint!! 

Best burgers ever!

data.title: WIN for metal lovers and food lovers!
data.text:
just walking in, hearing the music and seeing the sights in this place made me miss Metallica's better music years. It makes you want to fire up a grill and crank up some great older heavy music! Seriously, i've already gone online to purchase several albums that I grew up listening to as a result of my visit.

The menu is killer, the fries are killer, the staff is killer... and the Jump in the Fryer burger is basically a chicken and waffles dish with a beef patty... served burger style. I highly recommend this place if you are into classic metal (any heavy music at all really) and/or burgers/interesting foods. 

I loved it so much I took home a shirt!

data.title: Great Truck Food
data.text: If you love the taste of truck food but hate eating outside and/or eating standing up then you should go to Grill'em. They have the best burgers and be sure to bring your adventures self too because this restaurant doesn't just serve your everyday hamburgers. They have all kinds of combination of foods like the Powerslave – brie, grilled apple, balsamic aioli, field greens and if you love spicy foods then you must try the Napalm Death – pepper jack, pickled jalapeno, cream cheese, jalapeno poppers, habanero aioli. So if you like wild and of the beaten track then eat here!!

data.title: The real deal
data.text: They have a variety of burgers but my all time favorite is the Behemoth which is a double grilled cheese sandwich with a half pound of meat in between. No joke this is a big burger and I suggest you have it cut in half and share it. Ask for it well done or it will be red in the middle. I also like the Primate fries which are the best ones on the menu. I come here all the time so if it's your first time go for the Behemoth with Primate fries.

data.title: Eat the Fries!
data.text: I wasn't aware that the guys who won the Great Food Truck Race had a storefront until I saw a deal on Groupon which of course I bought.  I went for lunch with a friend.  This area of Alhambra looks like it was hit hard in the recession but is trying to come back.  The restaurant is close to the movie theater which is a good location.  It is loud with heavy metal music which isn't my favorite but...it's their choice.  I had the burger with blue cheese which was good--not great.  I didn't think the meat was that tasty and I asked to have the onions grilled which made the hamburger fall apart.  I ended up with a soggy bun that I just didn't eat.  My friend had the Behemoth which was as advertised.  I think it's more reasonable for two since the "bun" is two grilled cheese sandwiches.  The stand out were the French Fries which were of different sizes which is genius.  Some of the fries were pillowy and tasted like baked potatoes while others were small and crunchy.  I loved them especially paired with their chipotle ketchup which was excellent.  They serve beer so I imagine that the vibe is much different at night.  At lunch, there were a smattering of friends and families.

data.title: Hardcore yummies
data.text: The buffalo chicken fries are some serious flavors. I'm having delicious flashbacks and can't wait to stop in again.

data.title: OMG
data.text: I come here 4 times a month.... and I freaking love it!!! I've had just about every burg including the veggie/chicken substitute. They have something for everyone and the prices are responsible. I'll pay a good amount for a good burg and it just so happens that this place is AMAZING!!! I highly recommend this place.

data.title: Not Fantastic
data.text:
Ate here for first time based upon Yelp reviews but it did not live up to the hype. We may have caught them at a bad time on hot Saturday afternoon. The place had a decent crowd but seemed unclean. The ice machine at the soda fountain broke so they were filling cups from the back. The cheese fries were good but pricey at $7 and the craft beer selection was decent. The stars of their menu, the 1/2lb burgers were undercooked yet dry. I ordered the one with bacon and pineapple but they used pineapple tidbits instead of a ring and they mostly fell out of the bun and lacked flavor and juiceyness.
Place has a heavy metal theme but the pressed wood walls didn't work as a replacement for sheet metal decor especially considering the theme. Lots of teenagers here so it must be a hangout.

data.title: "THE" BURGER
data.text: this is the burger for the bucket list people, THE burger. And if you don't trust my review it makes the top 10 for Los Angeles, they make their own buns, hipsters drink ratty old pabst out of cans, but they have really really good brews and veggie burgers for the ethical eaters

data.title: You'll love it!
data.text:
Grill Em All, the food truck that started the whole craze with long lines has a store front with long lines still.  But it's all worth it.  There's parking in the parking structure and is located in front of the movies.  With long lines it can be quiet hard to find a place to sit.  But don't fret.  I'll be back here.  

I tried the Cowboy To Hell and it comes with shredded chicken with the burger patty and bacon.  Delicious.  I would love to come back here to try Dee Snider.

data.title: Good burger. Pricey
data.text: this is a good restaurant if you're looking for something different and a little cutting edge. The burgers are very good and different than other places so expect to pay around the $10 price point. I like that I can get Olympia beer here...I can't find it anywhere else. The Metal theme is ok.

data.title: unique dining experience.
data.text: An original theme restaurant in the heavy metal genre.  The music was at an appropriate volume.  (Unlike a similar themed bar and grill in Chicago) The staff were all fans of the metal niche as displayed in their dress, tattoos and piercings.  They broke the stereotype with their upbeat attitude and extremely friendly service.  We were approached numerous times by staff members inquiring about our meal.  Which was excellent, I had a winger burger and fries, I ordered medium rare, the burger leaned more toward the rare than the medium and the fries were great.  I think they were hand cut but I can’t be sure.  In any case they were good.  I would defiantly recommend this place.  It will be a must visit place for my trips to LA.

data.title: MONSTER
data.text: THE BEHEMOTH burger is a killer. Hands down hand crafted burgers. Really bomb, enjoyed every bite of it but was unable to finish. A go to place if your hungry or was on a starvation diet.

data.title: Excellent restaurant
data.text: Fun little restaurant with Heavy Metal themed burgers.  Interesting toppings.  I'm a great neighborhood!

data.title: Huge burgers with some interesting ingredients
data.text:
The burgers are named after metal bands.  Fun to see what they put in these burgers because it is not your typical fare.   The Behemoth is well, huge..  Basically two grilled cheese sandwiches, one for each bun surrounding your basic burger.   It could not be finished, just to overwhelming with all that bread.  Someone else in our our party tried the Powerslave, which was a great combo of brie and apple compote around your burger.  Small but nice selection of beers on tap.  Located right next to a theater so there is plenty of free parking.  Lots of metal music playing.  Seating available outside.    Average price for a burger is $13.  Only the daily special includes fries, otherwise it is another $4 for fries..  Party of 3 was $70 for lunch including burgers, fries and beers.
Nothing fancy, but something fun to try.

data.title: Molly Hatchet is good
data.text: I enjoyed the Molly Hatchet burger.  It is served with bacon, maple syrup, and fennel sausage gravy.  I thought it worked well.  It is only served on Monday.  The staff was friendly even though I look far from "metal."  The metal atmosphere doesn't really suit my fancy but I liked the food.  The fries are properly double-fried and the serve them with complimentary garlic aioli.  They also have some other sauces one can use.  All-in-all, it's a pretty solid burger joint.  If you're not into the metal music blaring, you might want to consider take-out and even eat at one of the nearby tables in the complex it is located in.

data.title: Slow service
data.text: We came after they issued a Groupon, it took 35 minutes to receive our 2 burgers!  Food was good but the place was way overcrowded.
